text: Was just having a convo with another #RelapsingPolychondritis patient in my local area. [Having two of us in the same area is unusual given the rarity of our disease.] And on top of it we are both (relatively) young women, which can lead to doctors dismissing its severity.

text: @melindagates Empowering women is an important cause. Thank you. We must remember also all the women who are fighting rare disease and suffering, like my daughter @monicabe1 with #relapsingpolychondritis. Quite a battle! Mother, worker, patient. let‚Äôs hope for cures, they are orphan diseases
user_description:
An American married to an Italian.

  Life here is usually humane.  Good public education, medicine and hospitals for all, no guns, no death penalty.

Diagnosis of #RelapsingPolychondritis (RP) is often delayed, especially when there is an absence of ear/nose involvement. @DrEmilySomers explains that 64% of patients reported symptoms more than 5 years prior to being diagnosed with RP.

text: Writing up my exp. with #COVID19  (#coviddiary). I am immunocomp. from meds for #relapsingpolychondritis w/ airway manifestations. I am on #Tocilizumab and long-term Pred. Tocilizumab *may* have helped me handle #coronavirus due to its anti-IL6 effect. Overall I have been lucky.

Pantoprazole
Ondansetron

Doxycycline
